job_title: Senior Data Scientist - Intermountain Enterprise AI COE
job_Description: Job Description:  Use industry leading data science and artificial intelligence (AI) practices to deliver on Intermountain Healthcare’s mission to “Help people have the healthiest lives possible”; making healthcare more affordable and higher quality; and making a difference in the patients and communities we serve.         Data Scientists develop end-to-end data science applications that apply predictive, prescriptive, and cognitive analytic methods to system-wide clinical and operational strategic initiatives. Intermountain Data Scientists develop end-to-end data science products that apply predictive, prescriptive, and cognitive analytic methods to system-wide clinical and operational strategic initiatives and analytics products that serve both internal and external customers.         This position has the option to lead small teams of Data Scientists including: supporting team members professional development, fostering effective product life cycles, and developing and executing on team strategic objectives.     Intermountain is seeking to continue creating a diverse work culture to match the diverse communities we serve. We are looking for applicants from all backgrounds to help us get the best talent.         This position has remote work options to fit individual needs and preferences. We prioritize a strong team collaborative culture with a focus on work life balance.       Develops innovative data science tools and methods that result in products or strategic insights with significant return on investment while meeting project requirements and timelines.         Prepares data from diverse data stores for analytics including data mining and feature engineering within large datasets with complex classes and anomalies.      Employs advanced statistical techniques while effectively and accurately interpreting the results of quantitative models to achieve clear outcomes.      Proficiently uses statistical programming languages and tools appropriate for data science domains.      Proficiently uses scripting languages to work with API's, move data, and construct custom enterprise grade software utilities, applications, or analytic products to automate, improve, and operationalize quantitative models.      Quickly learns and appropriately applies cutting edge advanced analytic methodologies and tools in creative and novel ways.             Minimum Qualifications         Bachelor's Degree and four years of experience or Master's Degree and two years of experience. Degree must be earned in a related field such as statistics, data science, applied mathematics, computer science, information systems, or other quantitative and computational discipline. Education must be obtained from an accredited institution. Degree will be verified.   or Experience without a related degree will be considered if skill set and experience are robust.      Experience applying multiple statistical and machine learning modeling techniques (e.g., generalized linear models, tree-based classification, network analysis, simulation modeling, inferential statistics, natural language processing, other structured and unstructured analytical methods).      Experience programming using quantitative, procedural and statistical programming languages such as Python or R.      Experience developing custom machine learning methods.      Understanding of data science systems and applications.      Advanced experience using databases including design principles, data frameworks, and query languages.      Experience efficiently manipulating, combining, and analyzing large or complex data sets, including unstructured data sources.      Experience developing, analyzing, interpreting, and managing various complex data sets to drive insights with meaningful outcomes and demonstrated return on investment.      Successful experience leading and participating in advanced analytic projects from inception to model deployment and workflow integration.      Skilled in communicating technical insights through data visualization, verbal, written, and interpersonal communication.      Experience fostering data science partnerships across all levels of an organization through effective communication and relationship management.             Preferred Qualifications         Experience working in a collaborative, remote team environment.      Successful project experience working with advanced data analysis in a healthcare or insurance setting.      Experience integrating statistical and machine learning methodologies into workflows.      Experience reviewing code using statistical and data software tools like Python, R, SQL, Spark, Scala, etc.      Experience using or creating API's, functions, libraries, and/or packages.      Experience successfully using Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Hive, NoSQL, in-memory data stores, etc., and Cloud technologies such as GCP, Azure, etc.      Experience in the field of data science, including measured outcomes from the development and deployment of algorithms, applications, or products.      Lack of preferred requirements does not preclude candidates from being considered for this opportunity.           Please Note     All positions subject to close without notice. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.        Physical Requirements:         Interact with others requiring the employee to verbally communicate information.      Operate computers and other IT equipment requiring the ability to move fingers and hands.      See and read computer monitors and documents.      Remain sitting or standing for long periods of time to perform work on a computer, telephone, or other equipment.           Location:  Key Bank Tower       Work City:  Salt Lake City       Work State:  Utah       Scheduled Weekly Hours:  40

About the Job Outline of Department: The Venga NLP Data Collection and Translation department manage large-scale translation and multilingual data collection needs for some of the world’s largest companies. Our clients require multilingual data to be used in Machine Learning to improve AI, NLP and NLG. This includes but is not limited to: Translation of sentences Voice recording collection Annotating (box bunding) text/words on images Correction of machine transcription output Rating of machine translation output from different engines Annotation of text for gender, NER, PII and other Text categorization (Sentiment analysis) Collecting handwriting samples Plus many other new research projects being assessed Projects can start as small as $20k (especially during pilot phase when we are testing collecting methods and designing solutions) and can go up to multi-million-dollar projects covering 120 language directions. The team consists of Program Managers, PMs, and a Quality Coordinator. The project team is expanded during peak/larger projects. The department is fully backed up by Supply Chain, Quality, Engineering/Dev departments as internal services as well as a Solutions Architect to help design tooling for custom and new project types. We have developed tooling for all the above-named project types so the team regularly assesses if tooling can be reused, repurposed or if new dev is required. Job Description  Main Duties:  Creation of project plans and definition of project scope Definition and maintenance of project workflows Managing and monitoring of time, budget, and quality Ensuring project risks are analyzed, and a mitigation plan is in place Monitoring of project budgets and ensuring timely issuance of invoices Maintaining healthy project margins and remaining cognizant of project costs and margins Identifying gaps and/or project inefficiencies along with definition and execution of corrective course of action Maintaining healthy relationships with clientele along with timely report outs and communication Assign and monitor team members work along with performance evaluation Leading internal/external meetings including but not limited to regular production sync ups, report outs, quarterly business reviews, post-mortems, etc. Creation and maintenance of project/process documentation Anticipating and communicating resource needs POC for client complaints along with input on corrective action plans Qualifications Strong linguistic skills are a must to be able to assess the client’s specific needs and transfer that knowledge to Quality and the linguists. Understanding of different language rules and how that may impact the project scope. Experienced managing and negotiating large-scale projects. Able to scope technical needs from tooling requirements to automated QA checks to pass on to the engineers/Dev. 3 years translation industry experience (preferably on the vendor side) Fluent in English (written/spoken) with at least 1 additional language. Able to work flexible hours but if based in Europe, willing to overlap with US when needed to meet with clients. Able to travel internationally to attend events and client meetings (when the time allows again). APPLY

Who We Are:    Pathloom, a pre-seed technology startup in the outdoor recreation space, is looking for a Chief Data Scientist to join our engineering team, and facilitate the development of our outdoor travel planning technology. We are utilizing our unique platform to simplify the outdoors discovery and planning process, and we’re looking for an experienced technology professional with an interest in entrepreneurship and perhaps a passion for the outdoors to help us succeed in our mission! We’re building the world’s first all-in-one outdoor travel planning app, and we want your help!   Who You Are:    We are seeking a proactive, self-motivated, organized technology professional with a true hustler mentality to join our core team as a Chief Data Scientist. We want someone with a passion for technology, who has  extensive experience in GIS and database operations . Our ideal candidate is agile, can communicate effectively, and can adapt to new challenges as they arise, who is willing to speak up and make suggestions on improvements to our processes as needed. We want our candidate to have experience with (and be passionate about) early-stage, pre-seed startups, and ideally we are looking for someone who loves the outdoors as much as we do!   Minimum Requirements:       6+ years Data Science/Analysis experience    BS in Computer Science/Engineering, Data Science/Engineering, or GIS    Proficiency in R, Python, PostgreSQL, ArcGIS, QGIS, REST APIs    Experience working with algorithms and databases    Previous startup experience    Previous Big Data experience    Strong GIS Background    Strong mathematics background     Preferred Experience:       10+ years Data Science/Analysis experience    MS in Computer Science/Engineering, Data Science/Engineering, or GIS    Proficiency in MapBox, Github, AI/ML/NLP, Crawling    Software Engineering / Computer Science background    Past Senior Data Science role    Early-stage startup experience (pre-seed)     What You’ll Do:    This position provides an opportunity for an experienced technology professional to join a startup in its early stages, and play an active role in building out the technology that will launch us through multiple phases of rapid growth and development as both a technology platform, and as a company overall! Your role will be to own all data acquisition, processing, and management operations; and manage all database and GIS operations as well. This is an especially important role as we work to integrate data from multiple sources into our app and develop comprehensive databases of outdoor recreational opportunities throughout the country.   If you’re interested in rolling up your sleeves and joining our team’s journey through Beta and beyond, (and appreciate heading into the Great Outdoors whenever possible), we’d love to hear from you!   _ > > Please be sure to answer all of the supplemental questions within this application process! Candidates who do not answer all questions will not be considered for this role. _   _ _ * *   Find out more about our company at http://www.pathloom.com! Education:      Bachelor's (Preferred)     Experience:      Python: 1 year (Preferred)    SQL: 1 year (Preferred)    GIS: 1 year (Required)    Data science: 6 years (Required)     Work Location: Remote

IonQ is developing the world's most powerful full-stack quantum computer based on trapped-ion technology. We are pushing past the limits of classical physics and current supercomputing technology to unlock a new era of computing. Quantum computing has the potential to impact every area of human society for the better. IonQ's computers will soon redefine industries like medicine, materials science, finance, artificial intelligence, machine learning, cryptography, and more. IonQ is at the forefront of this technological revolution.   We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist. As Senior Data Scientist, you'll be part of a cross-functional team whose mission is to lead IonQ on its journey to build the world's best quantum computers to solve the world's most complex problems.  Quantum computers require precise control of the qubits to implement logic gate operations needed for computation. Imperfections in the control process, as well as the degradation of the qubits due to coupling to the environment, lead to errors in the gate operations that reduce the accuracy of long quantum computational tasks. Trapped ion qubits are of highest quality and have very long coherence times, however, errors can be introduced by control signals. The use of advanced control signals can reduce these errors and lead to higher-performing quantum computers. We are looking for a data scientist who can work closely with our engineers in collecting and analyzing data from our quantum computers, to devise better control signals that lead to higher performance gate operations.  Responsibilities:   Work with experimental and theoretical physicists, system operators and software engineers to collect and analyze data from IonQ quantum computers to develop deep understanding of the error processes in our qubits and gates  Apply stringent statistical tools, mathematical methods and novel modeling techniques to develop comprehensive and accurate error models for our gates  Devise improved control mechanisms to mitigate the dominant errors in the gates  Develop data analysis tools that embody these methods, to be used by the system to control errors during quantum computer operation  Document the error models and control methods developed in the process  Work closely with the system development team to provide insights in error and control perspective to help build better quantum computers   You'd be a good fit with:   Bachelor's degree in physics, computer science, mathematics, statistics or similar fields, or similar levels of experience - unconventional backgrounds are welcome and encouraged  Over 10 years of experience working with data from quantum systems in understanding and constructing practical error models  Over 5 years of experience in developing data analysis methods or tools relevant to quantum computers or quantum systems  Excellent verbal and written communication skills  Demonstrated ability to write effective data analysis codes to handle large datasets and extract relevant correlation information   You'd be a great fit with:   Ph.D. in Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or related fields  Experience in applying research to relevant industry problems  Demonstrated experience in working with experimental scientists or engineers to apply data analysis techniques to a practical system of interest  Familiarity with qubits, atomic systems and coherent control techniques  Experience in applying machine learning techniques for data analysis problems  Our HQ is located in College Park, Maryland and we are a 15 minute metro ride from Washington DC. We are actively building out teams in the Washington D.C., Seattle, and Boston metro areas and will want to locate you in one of these geographies. However, IonQ will be expanding into additional geographies both domestically and internationally so don't let this stop you from applying.  At IonQ, we believe in fair treatment, access, opportunity and advancement for all, while at the same time striving to identify and eliminate barriers. We empower employees to thrive by fostering a culture of autonomy, productivity, and respect. We are dedicated to creating an environment in which any individual can feel welcomed, respected, supported and valued.  We are committed to equity and justice. We welcome different voices and viewpoints and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, and military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by law. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer.  If you are interested in being a part of this team and mission, we encourage you to apply.

Woodruff-Sawyer is looking for a highly analytical, skilled, and talented data scientist with excellent communication skills for the role of  Senior Data Scientist - Analytics . Under the direction of the Vice President of Commercial Lines Business Intelligence, the Senior Data Scientist will perform a wide range of duties involving data collection, data analysis, process automation and dashboarding. Job duties will also include collaborating with commercial business intelligence colleagues, downstream customers, and technology colleagues to understand data and analytics processes and streamline data extraction, data compilation, and related activities. This role will require a combination of multi-disciplinary skills in building scalable business intelligence assets (data-feeds, data-views, dashboards, reports) and in maintaining such assets. What You’ll Do The primary responsibility of this role is to support with the execution of data and analytics workflows for the business intelligence team and to evolve a common analytics platform. In doing so, you will: Compile and analyze data from various data marts into one analytics data mart. Implement models in production (in Excel, Python or mixed). Research and rectify data issues in currently published dashboards and data marts with Python and Tableau. Support our Property & Casualty and our Management Liability teams with data integration initiatives for third party data. Monitor and update analytics training modules regularly. This job is for you, if you have… A Master’s degree in Computer Science or related disciplines with 3 years of experience OR a Bachelor's degree with 5 years of experience. Expertise in technologies: SQL, Python, Excel, Tableau, Django/JavaScript, HTML, node.js/C++/Java, Angular/React and related technologies. Strong object-oriented programming skills. Excellent communication skills. Experience working and evolving technology infrastructure for analytics. Experience in building predictive models and analytical tools is a plus. The ability to: Develop intranet portals using web technologies. Create beautiful BI dashboards for client-facing sales and client-teams. Understand and apply complex calculations for evolving dashboards. Troubleshoot and rectify data and calculation errors at impeccable speed. Who We Are As one of the largest insurance brokerage and consulting firms in the US, Woodruff Sawyer protects the people and assets of more than 4,000 companies. We provide expert counsel and fierce advocacy to protect clients against their most critical risks in property & casualty, management liability, cyber liability, employee benefits, and personal wealth management. An active partner of Assurex Global and International Benefits Network, we provide expertise and customized solutions where clients need it, with headquarters in San Francisco, offices throughout the US, and global reach on six continents. We are a privately held corporation, owned 100% by our employees. Our benefits include: Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage 401k with company match and profit sharing Ownership in the company through our Employee Stock Option Program (ESOP) Paid vacation, holidays, and sick days Life Insurance, Short-term and Long-Term Disability benefits Flexible Spending Account (FSA) Wellness programs and workplace flexibility benefits Professional development and reimbursement programs Added perks like discounted event tickets, pet insurance, financial coaching, identity theft protection, etc. Woodruff Sawyer is an Equal Opportunity Employer. ABOUT US  Sust Global is transforming complex climate science into credible climate data. Using deep learning techniques to transform climate models, satellite, and geospatial data, we've created a one-stop-shop for physical climate risk & emissions insights, via a cloud-native analytics product. We are reinventing how the world assesses and adapts to the changing climate. We work with some of the largest financial institutions, enterprise corporations, and investors on the planet, helping them more accurately assess how climate affects their business, and to discover new sustainable opportunities.  WHO WE NEED  What you'll bring to the team:   Experience with climate modeling and working with large spatial datasets on fundamental climate variables  Experience working on analysis, validation and exploration with geospatial data in different formats: netCDF and geojson  Experience working on statistical inference, computer vision and data analytics on geospatial and multispectral earth observation datasets  Understand the data lifecycle and concepts such as lineage, governance, privacy, retention, anonymity, etc.  Experience with python and linux command line  Prior experience with cloud based data analysis tools and workflows  5-8 years of experience working on data heavy cloud-native software products  Graduate degree in atmospheric science, meteorology, climate/earth systems science, hydrology, civil/environmental engineering, astrophysics or similar fields; PhD/postdoc with professional work experience highly preferred  Experience with recruiting, hiring and managing technical staff   WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING ✍️  The impact you'll have:   Leverage your experience managing complex R&D projects to develop and deliver new product capabilities  Actively participate and lead an interdisciplinary team of scientists to develop new intellectual property  You will disseminate climate-related insights via internally and externally facing visualizations, published articles, and white-papers  You will have a wide impact on our current and upcoming base of customers to help distill complex climate data and frontier climate science into actionable signals  Lead cross-team research projects, collaboratively developing and executing project plans in partnership with multiple stakeholders  An opportunity to build, develop, and mentor a growing team of climate data scientists   BENEFITS   Work on a category defining product with a mission driven team to help the world adapt to our changing climate  Competitive salary and equity option grants  Company Sponsored 401k Plan  Generous PTO and Holidays (33 days per year)  Medical, Dental, and Vision Health Plans  Paid Parental Leave  Stipends for vacations, wellbeing and personal development  Offices in London and San Francisco with a flexible hybrid remote work environment   OUR CULTURE  As a company, we are a pro-diversity, highly inclusive organization, committed to bringing together people of all backgrounds. We know that a richly diverse team will help us to achieve our mission sooner.  We believe in empowered accountability - we expect our team to take responsibility, and in return we ensure that you have all of the tools and support required to get the job done. We are drivers not passengers in the creation of the climate economy.  Sust Global focuses on assessing and adapting to climate risks at the asset level, anywhere on earth. We have offices in London and San Francisco, and encourage remote and hybrid working. These roles are based in London/ hybrid.  You can view our website at  www.sustglobal.com  and find us on  Twitter  and  LinkedIn . You can contact us directly at  careers@sustglobal.com

job_title: Healthcare Economics Consultant, Data Science - Telecommute
job_Description: Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that's improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation isn't about another gadget, it's about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There's no room for error. Join us and start doing  your life's best work.(sm)      This role is in Optum Care’s Healthcare Economics (HCE) team primarily serving the Care Delivery Organization (CDO) markets located in Texas and Florida. As part of the Texas and Florida HCE Affordability team, you will work with both Optum National HCE and local CDO SME’s to deliver products identifying healthcare affordability savings opportunities. This position will report to the HCE Affordability Associate Director of the Texas and Florida region.      This individual will have access to one of the largest healthcare databases in the world. An ideal candidate will have a natural curiosity and excitement to deeply explore these databases and uncover insights hidden in plain sight. As a result, an especially strong candidate will possess the technical ability to efficiently navigate and wield this data to create quantitative models identifying healthcare affordability savings opportunities. Importantly, an ideal candidate would also understand the challenges of working with real-world data and know how to set both realistic expectations and realistic solutions.      You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.      Primary Responsibilities:           With strategic speed, create quantitative models to identify affordability savings opportunities       Develop a pipeline of testable analytical ideas for identifying affordability savings opportunities       Query SQL databases to build training data sets and provide analytical reports       Coordinate with partner Optum HCE SME’s to identify or enhance affordability savings opportunities       Regularly engage customers and stakeholders for providing feedback, delivering project updates, and brainstorming ideas       Support other on-going national HCE projects by providing technical expertise            You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.      Required Qualifications:           2+ years of experience using R or Python       2+ years of experience fitting predictive statistical models or machine learning models       Proficient using data science related packages. Python examples: Scikit Learn, NumPy, etc. R Examples: tidyverse, mlr3, caret, ggplot2, etc.       Proficient querying SQL-based databases for building analytical data sets       Proficient wrangling, cleaning, joining, and analyzing large and complex data sets       Adept at presenting technical findings to both a technical and general audience          Preferred Qualifications:           Graduate degree in an applied research field. Ability to perform independent research in a real-world environment       Experience analyzing healthcare data       Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of this role. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination prior to employment to ensure compliance             To protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies now require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. In addition, some roles require full COVID-19 vaccination as an essential job function. UnitedHealth Group adheres to all federal, state and local COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidates prior to employment to ensure compliance. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employment.      Careers with Optum.  Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do y  our life's best work.(sm)      Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only:  The salary range for Colorado residents is $64,800 to $116,000. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $71,400 to $127,400. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.      *All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.         Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected bylower 48 law.      UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.        Job Keywords: Healthcare Economics Consultant, Data Science, Telecommute, WFH, Work From Home, WAH, Work At Home

Lambda's mission is to accelerate human progress with computation. Our Deep Learning workstations, servers, and cloud services power Machine Learning engineers at the forefront of Artificial Intelligence research, fueling advancements in quantum computing, cancer detection, autonomous aircraft, drug discovery, self-driving cars, and much more.  Lambda provides Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning infrastructure to organizations like Intel, Microsoft, Amazon Research, Tencent, Kaiser Permanente, MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, and the Department of Defense.  Join us in building the future of Artificial Intelligence.  About the Role  As an AI Solutions Engineer, you will partner with customers working on deep learning at large enterprises, major research institutions, and venture-backed startups, to design compute infrastructure that meets their specific needs. While some customers require only a single workstation or server, others need large compute clusters and you will provide guidance that is tailored both to the customer’s deep learning application and to the scale at which they are currently operating.  What You'll Do   Advocate for Lambda’s Products.  Develop and maintain expertise in Lambda’s hardware and software tools.  Demonstrate Lambda’s hardware and software to customers, partner companies, and staff.  Write internal and public technical content.  Provide technical feedback from customers to Lambda’s product and marketing teams.  Own the technical side of Lambda’s sales process.  Partner with Lambda account managers to provide an excellent customer experience throughout the sales process.  Work with deep learning engineers and IT professionals from our customer’s internal teams to identify the challenges and bottlenecks they hope to overcome.  Design compute solutions that meet the customer’s needs by applying your technical skills, seeking customer feedback, and iterating as needed.  Document your designs in various formats including white-papers, wire diagrams, BoMs, and rack elevations.  Develop and maintain expertise in compute for deep learning.  Build structured and purposeful learning into your work routine.  Become an expert in GPU training and inference workloads.  Stay up to date on the latest deep learning compute hardware trends and experiment with them using internal tools and resources.  Develop high quality processes and documentation.  Reinforce Lambda’s positive culture throughout the organization.   You   Love learning both broadly and deeply.  Are a skilled communicator who can translate technical concepts into plain english and vague customer needs into technical requirements on the fly.  Are able to craft excellent technical documentation.  Have had a technical role working with computer hardware on a pre-sales or engineering team.  Are comfortable executing simple commands in Ubuntu or another Linux distribution.  Measure yourself on results, not effort, and constantly seek to accomplish more by becoming more efficient.  Are able to build strong relationships across your entire organization.  Listen carefully and understand deeply.   Nice To Have   Experience with GPU distributed training  Experience with MLOps platforms  Experience with a parallel file system  Experience with data center networking equipment  Experience with SLURM, Kubernetes, or other job scheduling systems   About Lambda   We offer generous cash & equity compensation.  Investors include Gradient Ventures, Google’s AI-focused venture fund.  We are experiencing a high rate of growth and have 10x’d over the last 3 years.  Our research papers have been accepted into top machine learning and graphics conferences, including NeurIPS, ICCV, SIGGRAPH, and TOG.  We have a wildly talented team of 75, and are growing fast.  Our remote workforce, based on role, is across the U.S., with headquarters in San Francisco.  Health, dental, and vision coverage for you and your dependents.  Commuter/Work from home stipends.  401k Plan.  3 weeks Annual Paid Time Off.   A Final Note:  You do not need to match all of the listed expectations to apply for this position. We are committed to building a team with a variety of backgrounds, experiences, and skills.  Equal Opportunity Employer  Lambda Labs is an Equal Opportunity employer. Applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, sex, gender, marital status, sexual orientation and identity, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship, or any other factors prohibited by local, state, or federal law.
