job_title: Client Technical Professional – Data and AI – Watson AI
job_Description: Introduction      IBM is seeking an experienced Data and AI Technical Sales Specialist who will be a technical sales consultant and trusted advisor to our clients. This individual will work with our IBM Financial Sales team to help drive revenue for our Business Intelligence, Analytics, AI & Cloud Pak’s in conjunction with our Watson API offerings in the Banking, Insurance and Financial Markets industry vertical.              Your Role and Responsibilities      You will learn the client's business requirements, technical requirements and/or competitive landscape and apply your technical knowledge and experience to bring new solutions to your aligned clients.     Additional Responsibilities           Actively develop and progress opportunities for Data and AI & Cloud Pack for Data Platform Solutions working with the IBM Sales teams       Provide strategic direction to Executive decision-makers related to their Information Architecture to support business transformation and their journey along the AI Ladder.       Deliver solution workshops, product demonstrations, technical education, and Proof of Concepts while articulating business value for all our Data & AI solutions.       Enable and support and the Business Partner ecosystem.       Develop re-usable industry-specific assets and demonstrations.       Collaborate with other internal IBM teams to drive unmatched customer satisfaction.       Establish deep technical account relationships at each client site.       Maintain an understanding of the client’s industry, including industry trends, industry business processes       Collaboration with IBM sales teams to define, design, and detail the technical aspects and feasibility of proposed solutions.       Support customer technical escalations, on-site health checks, best practice sharing, designing solutions; and answer technical questions throughout the sales process in order to progress/close sales and develop customer relationships.               Required Technical and Professional Expertise                The successful candidate will be passionate about Cloud technology and an interest in AI applications. They also will have a strong understanding of the use of API’s in Business applications.       Hands-on experience with Python.       Minimum of 3 years previous experience in a Technical Sales/Solution Consultant/System Engineer role       Minimum of 3 years of relevant Industry Experience: Banking, Insurance, Financial Markets or Equiv.       Proven demonstrated skill and experience with a breadth of Data & AI technologies including two or more of the following: RedHat OpenShift, Kubernetes, BI/Analytics tools, Watson AI, Machine Learning, Hadoop/Spark, Data Virtualization, Data Visualization, Hybrid Cloud or Public Cloud.       In-depth Cloud Platform knowledge in one of the following: Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform/Anthos, Amazon/AWS.               Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise                Ability to understand business problems, articulate a corresponding solution based on IBM software, build a value proposition, and establish a compelling reason to act       2 years of experience selling and demonstrating AI based solutions to Financial Services clients.       In-depth Cloud Platform knowledge in one of the following, a plus: Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform/Anthos, Amazon/AWS.       Hands on technical skills, knowledge and experience with RedHat OpenShift, a plus.       Red Hat Certified Specialist in OpenShift Administration, a plus.                           About Business Unit      IBM has a global presence, operating in more than 175 countries with a broad-based geographic distribution of revenue. The company’s Global Markets organization is a strategic sales business unit that manages IBM’s global footprint, working closely with dedicated country-based operating units to serve clients locally. These country teams have client relationship managers who lead integrated teams of consultants, solution specialists and delivery professionals to enable clients’ growth and innovation. By complementing local expertise with global experience and digital capabilities, IBM builds deep and broad-based client relationships. This local management focus fosters speed in supporting clients, addressing new markets and making investments in emerging opportunities. Additionally, the Global Markets organization serves clients with expertise in their industry as well as through the products and services that IBM and partners supply. IBM is also expanding its reach to new and existing clients through digital marketplaces.               This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date, where legally permissible. Proof of vaccination status will be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical, pregnancy or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.                      Your Life @ IBM      Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.          Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.          It's time to define your career.                      About IBM      IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.          Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.           At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.                      Location Statement      IBM offers a competitive benefits program which may include medical, dental, vision, paid holidays, paid sick time, paid vacation, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), life insurance, IBM 401(k) Program and Employee Stock Purchase Plan.          This position is eligible for participation in an IBM sales incentive plan. Actual incentive opportunity will be based on performance and the eligible Target Incentive, as addressed in the applicable plan, all of which is subject to change.          We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.                      Being You @ IBM      IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Limetree When you first saw us, we’re pretty sure you may have thought, “who is Limetree?” Unless you know us, we won’t blame you. So, before we get into what we’re looking for, we wanted to take an opportunity to introduce ourselves... the company, its principles, and the people behind it. Because we aren’t simply looking for employees, we want partners in our growth.   Limetree is a science-driven marketing company taking the best of data science, behavioral science, and deploying those strategies broadly yet to specific people. We don’t settle for the status quo. We focus on growth and execution and find people who continuously seek to understand why something works. Whether it’s a deeper dive into results (a word you’ll hear around here quite often) with data or a look into what’s driving consumer decisions with behavioral science, we constantly push for the next level of knowledge and performance for our clients.   Limetree is nimble and dynamic (that’s a fancy way of saying “there is no dead weight on our team”) with established success and a strong growth curve. We own a solid financial position with no debt, which allows us to reward our people for delivering excellence to our clients and investing in new marketing innovations. We adhere to the principle that if you do things right, you will grow based on the value you provide to your clients. We have consistently proven that it works year over year.   Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Limetree, LLC . (remote with preference for Dallas, TX or Plano, TX candidates)   Limetree is a behavioral marketing company with a goal to  create solutions that unite data and behavioral science to define the new standard in marketing performance . The Machine Learning Engineer is critical to the “data” side of our goal, as this person implements, scales, hardens and expands the machine learning products created by Limetree Data Scientists. Are you eager to push the bounds of data platforms? Do you want to find out what happens when the data scientist get MORE data to use? Do you say “better, faster, bigger” instead of “good enough, fast enough, big enough?” Then this role is for you.   This product-centered Senior Machine Learning Engineer will help us scale our models and machine learning data products. This means faster processing for newly loaded data sets, high-quality standardization and data characterization for new data sets, and outputs that meet rigorous checks for quality and completeness.   Limetree expects that the Machine Learning Engineer solving these problems will bring an innovative, collaborative, and flexible mindset to the team. This engineer will work closely with fellow team members to probe proactively for “what’s next,” “what’s faster,” and “what’s better,” and loves and is well connected to the technology landscape to hear the latest trends, most useful tools, and disruptive innovations that will boost us on our way to uniting data and behavioral science.   Responsibilities      Assist with scaling depth (size of data sets) and breadth (features in use) of data products supporting our Goldminer product    Automate and scale loading of data sets that support our data features library    Support testing and prototyping activities, using cloud-native capabilities, API and interaction layers for data products    Assist with maintaining secure, compliant, and high-quality data and analytics and machine learning operations    Maintain and improve AWS-hosted data-processing services that support Limetree’s data and analytics operations    Partner with other members of the Analytics and Technology teams to enable rapid delivery of insights, reporting, and data sets     Requirements To be successful in those tasks, we’re looking for some important experience:      Current Python 3 (pandas in particular), SQL, and git experience (our primary modeling and machine learning tools are Python based)    3-5 Years of proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, Data Engineer, or similar role    Fluency with SQL and Relational Databases, like PostgreSQL, Snowflake, or SQL Server    Experience with AWS, especially compute and data-related services within AWS such as EC2, S3, Dynamo, EFS. We actively evaluate new AWS technologies as appropriate    3+ years working in Linux    Familiarity with scaled distributed data frameworks such as dask or PySpark    Experience implementing and data evaluation frameworks to thousands of features    Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Informatics, or related field    Have a good work ethic, a desire to be efficient, learn and be challenged, and be self-driven and motivated    Excellent written and verbal communication skills    We will ask you to present a sample of your work from problem definition, modeling techniques considered, and explanation of the “why” in the model     Candidates should fit in with a friendly, family-flexible team that enjoys supporting each other as we tackle some cool problems.   Job Type: Full-time   Pay: $90,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year   Benefits:      401(k)    401(k) matching    Health insurance    Paid time off     Schedule:      Monday to Friday     Supplemental Pay:      Bonus pay     Application Question(s):      Do you now or will you in the future require visa sponsorship to work in the United States? If yes, please describe your anticipated visa sponsorship requirements.    Provide your undergraduate GPA (4 point scale) and graduate school GPA for your most relevant degree (also 4 point scale)     Education:      Bachelor's (Preferred)     Experience:      Python: 3 years (Required)    Machine Learning or Data Engineer: 3 years (Required)    AWS: 1 year (Preferred)     Work Location: Remote

job_Description: Title : Senior Decision Analyst   Position Type : Contract to Hire Location :  REMOTE:   Columbus, OH, United States ***Candidate must be able to convert to full time / perm without sponsorship ***   JOB DESCRIPTION   Our client’s Enterprise Analytics department is growing, and they are looking for an outstanding candidate to join their Digital Analytics team. The primary focus of the Senior Decision Analyst is to optimize current and future digital investments across Marketing by following a test and learn framework. As part of this role, a decision analyst will mine, report, and analyze both internal and external data to determine campaign performance across channels. They will evaluate business operations using statistical and financial methods to ensure that testing, learning, and production goals are met, as well as providing insights about the client’s customers and prospects to drive business strategy. These analysts work collaboratively with client’s internal partners to develop innovative, data-driven growth strategies across the entire bank, including Consumer Deposits, Small Business, Home Lending, Credit Card, Auto, and Commercial. Our client’s goal is to be the Best performing Regional Bank in America, and they need data and analytics to meet that goal.   Key Responsibilities   · Mine client's digital data across multiple platforms to create customer insights (web traffic, search engine, third party)   · Track online marketing trends, report on campaign performance, present actional insights to inform and develop digital marketing strategies   · Create dashboards, data visualizations, and campaign and website performance reports.   · Apply machine learning, data mining, and visualization techniques to internal and external data to make accurate and actionable analyses in a timely fashion.   · Plan and execute multiple analytic projects at once in response to business needs.   · Synthesize findings into senior level presentations that convey insights and recommendations through compelling storytelling, while maintaining a balance between the big picture and mastery of details.   · Champion corporate policies and procedures. Ensure compliance with legal and regulatory requirements. Work with management to develop and apply effective risk management processes and controls.   Basic Requirements   · Master's degree in Analytics, Economics, Decision Sciences, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Business, or related field.   · A minimum of 5 years of experience in data mining, programming, or statistical analysis.   Preferred Skills and Characteristics   · PhD degree in Analytics, Economics, Decision Sciences, Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Business, or related field.   · Experience working with data mining models, structures, theories, principles, and practices, including machine learning, statistics, and text mining techniques.   · Deep knowledge of digital marketing across search engine marketing, social, display, and programmatic platforms   · Experience performing advanced digital analytics such as multi-touch attribution, reading cross-channel digital campaigns, media mix modeling, and multivariate testing.   · Experience with business intelligence and data mining tools such as Tableau   · Experience with SQL queries of large databases such as Oracle, DB2, SQL Server, Teradata, and Hadoop.   · Experience developing and applying statistical methods in a corporate environment through applications such as R or Python.   · Experience in similar or directly related functions, preferably in financial services, retail, healthcare, telecommunications, entertainment, or other industries with strong direct marketing, digital marketing, risk management, or experimental design practices.   · Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a proven ability to interact effectively across all organizational levels.   · Progressive thinker and problem solver, with a strong ability to manage ambiguity/complexity. Ability to work effectively in teams as well as independently across multiple tasks while meeting aggressive timelines.   · Experience working in a consumer-centric company and with teams of technical professionals in a cross-functional environment.   · Ability to embrace change, constructively negotiate constraints, and effectively leverage resources to create exceptional outcomes.   · Consistently model and inspire high levels of professional demeanor and integrity.   Job Types: Full-time, Contract   Pay: From $100,000.00 per year   Schedule:      8 hour shift    Monday to Friday     Experience:      Tableau: 5 years (Required)    SQL database: 5 years (Preferred)    Python: 4 years (Preferred)     Work Location: Remote

osition Title: Data Science Practitioner   Location: Remote   Position Status: Contract   Position Description:   Our client is looking for Data Science Practitioner candidates for a position that is currently remote.   Role Description:   Technical Skills:   Skill   Years/Level of Experience   Artificial Intelligence(AI)   P4 – Expert   Natural Language Processing (NLP)   P4 – Expert   Python   P4 – Expert   Machine Learning   P4 – Expert   PostgreSQL   P4 – Expert   Role Description:      Masters +2 years of experience or 6 years relevant work experience    Excellent oral and written communication skills    Formulate and rapidly prototype various approaches as well as effectively communicate the pros and cons of each.    Excellent time management    Ability to contribute to a high-performing, motivated workgroup by applying interpersonal and collaboration skills to achieve project goals    Provide technical guidance in the fields of NLP, Machine Learning, Statistical Methods    Provide data-driven approaches to tackle various business and NLP problems    Ability to contribute to the creation of an environment that motivates individuals to work collaboratively as a team    Masters +2 years of experience or 6 years relevant work experience    Excellent oral and written communication skills    Formulate and rapidly prototype various approaches as well as effectively communicate the pros and cons of each.    Excellent time management    Ability to contribute to a high-performing, motivated workgroup by applying interpersonal and collaboration skills to achieve project goals    Provide technical guidance in the fields of NLP, Machine Learning, Statistical Methods    Provide data-driven approaches to tackle various business and NLP problems    Ability to contribute to the creation of an environment that motivates individuals to work collaboratively as a team     Requires proficiency in:      Python (required)    Regular Expressions    SQL (PostgreSQL)    No-SQL (MongoDB)    Version control systems (Git)    Experience with ML frameworks: Tensorflow, PyTorch, Transfomers, Scikit-learn XGBoost, LSTM, Keras, Pandas, BERT, CNN, RNN, SVMs, k-Nearest Neighbors, Linear/Logistic Regression and Classification, Ensemble Methods, Graphical Models, Clustering, Tesseract    Information Extraction    Statistical model building (particularly classification)    Ability to draw insights from sparsely labeled textual data.    Ability to leverage domain knowledge as well as ontologies to improve model performance     Strong understanding of statistical modeling and experimental design including:      when to value precision vs recall    bias/variance tradeoffs    handling sampling issues    ability to improve performance on noisy data (both textual and numeric)     Knowledge of and experience using various NLP approaches, particularly:      Pattern recognition/feature extraction    Supervised, Unsupervised, and Semi-Supervised learning techniques    Understanding of various language models (N-Gram, Skipgram, NLM, etc.)    Practical experience leveraging open source libraries for emerging DNN approaches to NLP (transformers, BERT, RoBERTA, etc.)    Chunking/Tokenization    Semantic parsing     The following skills are not required but are highly desired:      Experience with NLP technologies    Experience with machine learning    Web Service technologies such as SOAP, WSDL, WS-Security, MTOM, SWA    Relational Databases such as DB2, Oracle, MySQL, SQL, JDBC    NoSQL databases such as MongoDB and HBase    Hadoop, Spark, HDFS, MapReduce, YARN, Scala, MapReduce, Pyspark    XML processing experience such as XSD, XPath, XSL, XSLT, etc.    ebXML    IBM MQ Series     About Seneca Resources:   Seneca Resources is a client driven provider of strategic Information Technology consulting services and Workforce Solutions to government and industry. Seneca Resources is a leading IT services provider with offices in Virginia, Alabama, Georgia, Florida and Texas that service clients throughout the United States.   We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and value the benefits of diversity in our workplace.
